website_summaries.verdict: A cheap alternative to the Franklin Professional Set that features lighter mallets.
pros: The lightweight mallets are great for kids and have brightly colored handles
The chestnut finished wood looks and feels great
Includes everything needed to play and comes in a convenient carrying case
cons: The cheap wood can cause the mallets to fall apart after moderate use

customer_reviews.title: leaving those two mallets useless. The wood in the stakes is also very ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought the expert set with screw-in brass fittings on the mallet heads and mallets. Unfortunately, the screws that hold the brass fittings in place on the mallet heads are only about 1/2" in length and the wood in the mallets is very soft. So, the first time our family of responsible adults and small children tried to use the set, the screws on two of the mallet heads ripped right out of the heads, leaving those two mallets useless. The wood in the stakes is also very soft and one broke at the base when hit with a ball. See pics.
customer_reviews.author: FayLee

customer_reviews.title: Not a Regulation Croquet Set: miniature balls and mallets.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a croquet set, it is a pint size version of a regulation set. The mallets and balls are about 2/3 the size of an official croquet set. I have to cut my grass as low as my lawnmower will cut to get the proper roll of regulation size balls struck by regulation size mallets and am certain this set would make it impossible to play the game as it is intended to be played on lawn grass. When you spend $35 for something with a price range of $35 -$200, you should expect there is something wrong - dumb me.
customer_reviews.author: Mr ED

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This is the cheapest set I've seen in awhile. There is some kind of wood filler in a knot in the mallet. There are also splits in the ends of the mallets. All this was before they were even used. After use there are lots of dents in the mallets. I do not recommend this set at all. No kids used this set
customer_reviews.author: Dan Hayward

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Quality Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in (Late May, the 25th) time for Fourth of July, unfortunately opened the box on the 3rd of July to try them out. First contact with the ball and the plastic ends of the mallet started to rip and split, the next few contacts resulted in more destruction. We were not abusing the product it is just the quality....POOR..... I want to return them but Amazon says it's my mistake, it has been more than a month since I purchased them. They are definitely not worth buying
customer_reviews.author: TIM F.

customer_reviews.title: Lousy support, broken parts
customer_reviews.text: Product came with broken parts. When you call the support number all you get is a recording that says due to very high call volume we can’t answer the call. I tried calling multiple times. Tried to use the set and more parts broke. The mallets are cheaply constructed and the screws that hold them together just tear loose. We purchased the Expert set Waste of $80. Im glad I have Prime and they honor a return.
customer_reviews.author: JVMX

customer_reviews.title: Mallets fall apart after one use
customer_reviews.text: The negative reviews on this product are correct. Item is Franklin Sports 53001 Vintage Croquet Set. The set looks nice when assembled, but is made of soft wood instead of hard wood. It only took my wife less than one minute to have the mallet fall apart. The screws holding the handle to the mallet head ripped out as soon as she hit the ball. She did not hit hard. It is obvious that they all will fail in the same way. The design and appearance was nice. If the set was made of quality materials, I would have paid $100.00 more for it. Instead, it is only good for decoration. Returning, thanks Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: GatorFan

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart quickly
customer_reviews.text: We bought this set because it came with a nice looking stand, however I wish we'd spent a lot less and gotten one with a bag instead. The stand is not well made, the straps that should hold the wickets doesn't stay closed. The mallets won't stay in their holders either and the wheels barely turn. The mallets themselves are made of poor quality materials. The heads are loose on the shaft because you can't screw them in tightly. After 3 games we had one of the heads break off. Overall the build quality on this set is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Mims

customer_reviews.title: I purchased these as a gift and apologetically took them back - Such low quality it is a shame.
customer_reviews.text: Just lacked any feel of quality. True the price is low - but the quality is lower. This set deserved a little more effort in the way it was made and packaged. For example - The great canvas case will not hold the mallets with heads attached. The heads lack any real weight. The plastic caps are so cheap it is sad. the painted stripes look like they were done by a child (perhaps they were). The heads screw with a wooden thread on to the handle but it is lose and wobbles. Just not really what such a game and set deserve. I purchased these as a gift and apologetically took them back with promises of something better.
customer_reviews.author: Just added water

customer_reviews.title: Better than average budget set
customer_reviews.text: Nice set, my only reservation being the cradle is less sturdy than I’d expected. Mallets balls and hoops are fine, especially considering cost. Easy to assemble, wheels are more ornamental so you drag rather than tow across grass..nonetheless happy with purchase. Be interesting to see how holds up to sustained use, but so far so good with occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Quaint, but not well designed.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the look, but the stand does no function well. It does not roll well at all. The makers are difficult to get into place. The stand was broken in arrival, not packed well. My husband modified the stand after the repair work. It works a bit better, but overall not pleased with it. Still love the look, i wish it worked better. FYI, if you order one, allow 3 months before you use it. If it arrives broken, the replacement may not arrive in time. We ordered in plenty time for our event, but the replacement for the broken one would have arrived a month later.
customer_reviews.author: Allison G.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected for the price
customer_reviews.text: Used it once and had fun with no issues. Two of the six handles would not screw into the mallet as the threads were not right. Was able to get them together, permanently, with some tools and elbow grease. The storage bag is pretty useless for the entire set unless you want to unscrew the six mallets each time you store it, which in my case isn't possible now because of those two mallets mentioned above. Honestly better than I expected for the price overall.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice but quality is not.
customer_reviews.text: After two weeks of using on the weekends, two mallet handles completely broke in half mid-shaft. All the white plastic mallet head covers fell off day one. The balls also dent with impact of the mallet. Lastly one of the striped posts broke. We live in AZ and is dry so perhaps the wood they use just gets too brittle. Still, we have other wood products around the yard and don’t have the same breaking issue. I would probably avoid this product in favor of something higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Pinterics

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart on first use.
customer_reviews.text: We were excited to give this for Fathers Day. We’ve used it three times and each time something has broken. Will be contacting Franklin tomorrow but wanted to let people know. Screw from wheel bag, and now two mallets have come apart. Shame as it is a pretty set. Will amend after talking to customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Marin Kids Librarian

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality for your money!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this nostalgic gift for Father’s Day. Although we have enjoyed using this product we discovered early on that the quality is quite poor. Day two, two of the mallet ends cracked with normal use, nothing rough. The balls are chipping and the mallets are very light and flimsy compared to the set I remember using at my grandparents when I was young. This product will most likely not last the summer, so I am very disappointed that I will have to find a better quality set for next year and have basically wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: kkania

customer_reviews.title: why doesn't the bag fix once assembled?
customer_reviews.text: I like the mallets, they are sturdy and painted nicely. My problem with this set is with the bag to keep it the set in. The only way the whole set fits back into the bag... is to dismantle the mallets every time. Eventually the mallets won't stay together as well. If they had made the bag 4 to 6 inches longer, all would have fit in.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you are a serious player, don't buy this.
customer_reviews.text: This set looked nice, but is poorly constructed. The screws holding handles to mallet heads are 1/4" and should be at least 1/2". 5 of 6 mallets went flying off the handles as the screws stripped away in the first few hits. It's possible the balls are way too heavy for the mallets, too. One could glue on the handles, but the carrying case only holds the set if it is all completely taken apart. Also, one of the mallets heads cracked, with an outer layer falling off in the first game. The handles are too long for most players.If you are a serious player, don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: li

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: If you're reminiscing about a vintage croquet set, this is a big let down. These mallets are very light weight and feel flimsy. Two of the plastic caps on the mallet heads cracked after about 30 minutes of play. Definitely not worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Toes

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive way to introduce croquet back into your "Lawn Life"! :)
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this was a wonderful trip down nostalgia lane: I played croquet as a kid because it was fun & we had a great lawn for such games! This set has a carrying case, is colorful, has directions included on how to play, score, etc., which is very useful for those of us who completely forgot the rules or how to proceed. The only drawback is that the striping on some of the mallets needs a little more careful attention, so I'm off to Hobby Lobby to pick up some acrylic craft paints to match those stripes! :) This set is inexpensive, & should last many years with care of use.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Lewis Watts

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst waste of money on the planet. I ordered this set and in less than one week two mallets broke completely apart! I emailed the manufacturer, Franklin, and they have not bothered to respond. I purchased this in the beginning of April and I have now given them several weeks to get back to me... what a waste! If you want a croquet set, DO NOT purchase from Franklin!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Mullin

customer_reviews.title: Worked great! I know some customers were not happy with ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! I know some customers were not happy with the quality, but the ones we received seem to be holding up well. It seems like a good quality set for the money, and there are way too many out there to pick from.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I noticed this set due to the price and the description led me to believe it would last for some time. upon receiving the set, all expectations have been exceeded. the mallets are well made and the carrying bags are very nice to keep it all together. WELL DONE.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad connection between handles and mallet and useless carrying case.
customer_reviews.text: Once assembled together, the mallets would not fit in the carrying bag provided. The bag will only store all of the gear if it is disassembled again. We played a game of croquet and after just a little while the head of my mallet came loose. Upon investigation I found the wood threads in the head of the mallet were stripped and would no longer hold the stick in tightly. Thought about gluing it but decided it wouldn't likely last, so I returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Very first time we (adults) play it one of the mallet heads broke off. The screws simply pulled out of the wood. In addition the heads of the mallets spin, and can't be tightened. The hoops are the highest quality of the set. So dissatisfied and disappointed I could cry. For $150 plus you would think it would be quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Party Props
customer_reviews.text: This set served it's purpose for the "Alice in Wonderland" themed 50th Anniversary party in the yard as a prop for the queens court complete with cut out flamingo heads so the price was right for it's need. By the end of the party some of the mallets had lost the end caps on the head of the mallets. I suppose they can be glued. I was fine with the set but if you really intend for it to last a long time you better upgrade from this set. It might be fine for little kids just learning the game.
customer_reviews.author: GMAvco

customer_reviews.title: the weight of the mallets was far less than any others I've played with.
customer_reviews.text: We did set it up and played, The game itself is fun and entertaining. We've played this for years. I ordered this set when I visited my son who had just moved and still getting settled in. Perhaps more appropriate for children. My grand daughters are 13 & 15 and they didn't seem to mind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete Set
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to playing croquet in our back yard while we are locked in. This set is very nice, but the DID NOT INCLUDE THE RED HANDLE FOR THE MALLETS! I hope someone is actually looking at this to see if I can get the missing piece.
customer_reviews.author: Klyd

customer_reviews.title: Not a solid set
customer_reviews.text: The mallets are small and cheaply made. We are afraid of breaking them when we hit the balls. The metal rings are already bending after only two times playing it. I would recommend finding a better set. This was suppose to be a Christmas present for a family member. I'm glad that I checked everything over because I would have been embarrassed to give this away.
customer_reviews.author: TigerSpike

customer_reviews.title: WALK AWAY!!
customer_reviews.text: I was VERY disappointed in this product. I expected better quality from this brand name. Made very poorly. The handles would not screw into the mallets correctly. The straps to hold stakes on the side do not snap. The wheels don’t turn. The wire hangers won’t stay in place; holes not drilled correctly. Not worth $20 even.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect set for playing the occasional game with the family.
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty impressed with the overall quality of this set. I didn't want a set that was so cheap that the clubs fell apart, but I also couldn't afford 100s of dollars on a super-deluxe set either. This definitely fits the bill. The clubs are very good and the mallets stay on rather well, only needing minimal re-tightening. The balls are heavy and durable. It's the perfect set for playing the occasional game with the family. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: El Chupacabra

customer_reviews.title: DON"T BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to some previous reviews! This "Expert" item from Franklin Sports is trash! I bought it and it arrived as expected. The problem is on the very first play time with friends, 3 mallets broke at the screw in area, and 2 plastic balls started losing their covers. The wood pieces are cracking, and the design looks good, but is very flawed. Don't buy this item!!! And, I bought this set 3 months ago, and Amazon only covered return for 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: RandyB

customer_reviews.title: Croquet Fun
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a fun game. It’s well made and very colorful. We love that it comes with a storage/carry bag so everything stays together. My kids loved it and best of all the instructions/rules for the game where easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: SmilyArly

customer_reviews.title: Mallet broke on 5th swing !!
customer_reviews.text: This review is of the intermediate set. This set might work for kids, but certainly can't withstand adult strength. I bought this for a camping weekend with friends and one of the mallets broke beyond repair on the fifth swing. A second mallet broke the next day and a third mallet is visibly on its way out. So after a weekend of 4 games, half the set is trash. Buyer beware: You definitely get what you pay for here.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh it's Alright...
customer_reviews.text: This set is pretty flimsy we've only played a few rounds and broke two of the mallets. That being said it has provided a lot of fun for the family last weekend on Father's Day we played several rounds and all had a blast. For the price it was exactly what I expected a cheap set that does the job if your just looking for something to do in the backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Ward

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We just used this yesterday for the first time and noticed one of the mallets was defective. It looks like the wood was cracked and was painted or stained over to hide this. Other than this, we are very pleased with the set. We are going to try and repair the cracked one.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: It WILLbreak.
customer_reviews.text: So sad this was so cheaply made. Broke the first time using it. Broke more the next time. For the price point, it should last longer than a cheap set. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: JenD

customer_reviews.title: A nice set and exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: A nice set and exactly what I was looking for. I did have to nail a piece together and glue another spot, but it came assembled in just a few pieces, so I can't complain too much Wood was in good shape. Nice wickets.
customer_reviews.author: S. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Not well thought out
customer_reviews.text: Not too impressed - the mallets are a little light from what I remember and so the balls don't roll well unless you have just the right grass (and you won't find the right grass at most public parks). Also, why couldn't the mallet-handle screws be made of something a little more durable than rough-cut wood? The mallets don't fit in the bag unless you take them apart each time, and sure enough they're going to strip.
customer_reviews.author: MikeInWeston

customer_reviews.title: This is a well made set and we will enjoy it for years I am sure
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made set and we will enjoy it for years I am sure. Our only problem is the size of the wickets. It has a very narrow opening and makes it very hard for the little folks to be successful players without a lot of exasperation. And, I will admit I have experienced some also. But, that said, the wickets are the best quality ones we have ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: Martha S.

customer_reviews.title: I was playing with a 3 year old and it surprised us how easily the pieces broke
customer_reviews.text: First time we (myself and child) played with ours the plastic part to hit the ball broke and one of the handles broke in two. I was playing with a 3 year old and it surprised us how easily the pieces broke. I did buy it for it being light weight for the 3 year old....didn't think about the sturdiness of it.
customer_reviews.author: Twana Blevins

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Mallet poles not sturdy enough. Half broke in the first 2 weeks.Was tempted by the cost and should have invested more money. The balls seem undersized as well. Would not recommend. To be honest, used by adults. Perhaps if used exclusively by children they would not have broken. In addition, the height of the mallets also seems pretty short.
customer_reviews.author: JCPCG

customer_reviews.title: It would be best used as firewood
customer_reviews.text: It was purchased for maybe a few times of use but holy crap is this set bad. Would absolutely not recommend. If it didn't tear up so bad from the 1 time use I would return it. Seriously do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Swift

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with the product,but that was my fault.Should have read the details about the product properly and not have been taken in by the images. We already have a toy croquet set, and when I saw this, thought it looked a little more substantial than what we already have....but unfortunately not,the length of the sticks are even shorter than what we already have. I suppose I should read things properly, as by the time I paid for the product to be shipped to New Zealand I could have probably bought an adult set here.
customer_reviews.author: G n P

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described this is perfect. This is very durable and easy to use packaged perfect. Just all-around a great bye
customer_reviews.author: Wendy W.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and seems very well made but we haven't played ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and seems very well made but we haven't played it!! Our grass grows so quickly and the yard is uneven. Take that into account before purchasing this as it needs short grass and even planes.
customer_reviews.author: paige whitley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We bought the intermediate set. Worked just great. No problems with anything. Played multiple games and it was awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Porsche

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT waste your money! This broke before we even played. The wickets are regular wire wickets, but the wood is the weakest stuff I've ever seen. Like balsa almost. The poles broke just putting them in the ground. And the white caps on the sticks broke immediately on the first use.
customer_reviews.author: E. LaVoi

customer_reviews.title: Love these.
customer_reviews.text: Love these...we have had many groups over and have played with these probably 7 times since purchase and have no issues!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Assemble set won't fit in the bag
customer_reviews.text: After you assemble the mallets and shafts they won't fit back in the bag, which makes absolutely no sense. To pack the set in the bag, you need to separate 6 mallets from 6 shafts. May I suggest you add a few more cents to your manufacturing cost of the bag so a complete and assemble set can fit in?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No wickets, sticky or otherwise!
customer_reviews.text: Just opened the package for Labor Day picnic. Wanted to teach the grandsons how to play old-fashioned games. Much to our surprise, there are no wickets in the box. Package was factory sealed, so they must not have been inserted at the beginning. I would just be happy to receive a set of wickets. Rest of set is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: grammylyn

customer_reviews.title: doesn't fit in bag after assembled.
customer_reviews.text: It's not super high quality but def a good set for back yard fun with the kids. What i don't like is that after you put it all together, it won't fit back in the cool carrying case is comes with unless you take it back apart. I dont know about you, but i dont want to put it together and take it apart everytime i want to play.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: After waiting many many months from the time we ordered this set we finally received it in late November. To late to use it in 2015. Our first opportunity to play come yesterday and one mallet head had a big crack or split could not be used. Then during our game with balance of set 2 players got wood slivers in there fingers from the shafts holding mallet heads. All 6 mallet heads were in good shape at time of arrival in November of 2015. A poor grade or improperly seasoned wood must have been used?
customer_reviews.author: jer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: We bought the Vintage set a few years ago. Recently, one of the balls split. We contacted Franklin with photos, and they sent a replacement at no charge. So, excellent customer service. The heads of the mallets do tend to come loose, though, and need to be retightened during the game.
customer_reviews.author: Mary S

customer_reviews.title: Others have reviewed that the quality is low, but ...
customer_reviews.text: Others have reviewed that the quality is low, but I don't have that problem. I've had this set for a few months and only one mallet is broke (due to a nephew not playing with it properly). I'd buy again if I were looking for a cheaper, less expensive set.
customer_reviews.author: Jenniferp16

customer_reviews.title: Croquet set is a bit of a disappointment. The wood is low grade and most certainly ...
customer_reviews.text: Croquet set is a bit of a disappointment. The wood is low grade and most certainly will not hold up to a day of grown men with beers rocketing victim balls across the lawn. The balls and mallets don't seem to be standard sized. I suppose the set would be good for children, but for adults, everything seems miniature. The balls are small don't compare to the heavy wood balls of my childhood set. On the plus, everything fit together correctly and arrived in good condition. And Amazon delivered the set to my house in southern Mexico for free. Great job Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Fun, Fun, Fun
customer_reviews.text: Going to have fun with this in Spring! Made well.
customer_reviews.author: Faith Moore

customer_reviews.title: find a storage alternative.
customer_reviews.text: These are great, with the exception of having to take the mallets apart to fit them into the storage bag. They are wood, so taking apart and putting together often will damage them quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Alecia

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but seems to be poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great but I don't have confidence it will last long. I bought the set for family friends and so far we are not impressed. The mallets don't stay seated with the stick the balls gouge easily. The wickets are great and so are the steaks.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Matta

customer_reviews.title: Great set, undersized bag
customer_reviews.text: High quality components, reminds me of the set I grew up with, BUT the bag is undersized to hold the assembled mallets. Ok if you don't mind assembling them every time you play.
customer_reviews.author: Gil Brown

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Broke the first time the set was used. Had friends over to play, the mallet held up well, but on of the end poles snapped in half. Spend more for a better set.
customer_reviews.author: tony dutcher

customer_reviews.title: Great family fun
customer_reviews.text: Great family fun for not a hefty price. The handles to the mallets screw together. (on 2 of them the threads stripped so they was useless - I used wood glue to permanently repair it, but by doing so it no longer fit into the traveling case).
customer_reviews.author: Wildcat

customer_reviews.title: Light weight set
customer_reviews.text: this works nicely as a kids set, but is fairly light weight and the mallets flimsy. The plastic end pieces pop off frequently. The stakes are nice and sturdy and the white wickets are easy to see on grass.
customer_reviews.author: An

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor quality. Would not recommend purchasing
customer_reviews.text: Plastic caps on the end and the maker end fly off during game play. Played with this one time and the plastic caps broke and the maker end flew off the different times and almost hit a different family member including my 18month old on the first incident. Extremely poor quality. Would not recommend purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: it’s good
customer_reviews.text: really good set and it comes in a really nice carrying bag so you can store everything when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap, sticks dont last long
customer_reviews.text: One of the sticks split right down the middle, the second time we used the set. It wasn't even that hard of a hit, but it busted right up the center. Don't know if it was a manufacturing defect, or just a cheap product, but I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Broke with first use
customer_reviews.text: One of the mallets and end sticks broke first time using by my 6 year old son.
customer_reviews.author: karen gamble

customer_reviews.title: The pieces are well made of good material and stood up well to our handling
customer_reviews.text: Bought for grandkids, we had a ball. Hes 7, shes 3 and grandpa is. ( o never mind) we 3 kids had a ball. They caught on to the princi ple of the game an we had a time. The pieces are well made of good material and stood up well to our handling.
customer_reviews.author: DA

customer_reviews.title: Antique set not real wood... Very poor quality!!
customer_reviews.text: The antique set is useless... not real wood... some kind of a composite.. Mallets wouldn’t even fit in the stand.. mallets fell apart the 1st time using it... I had a $40 set for 20 years we used every summer with no problem.. So to spend over $100 no good...used 1 time and last time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a set from Walmart and the mallets were too short. This set is good for even the tallest person and very heavy duty! Well worth the money to get your family outside to have some fun. I wasn't sure my family would like to play, but they love it and want to bring it out every chance they get.
customer_reviews.author: Kathey ONeal

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality
customer_reviews.text: This item is the worst quality item I have purchased in a very long time. After maybe an hour, both stakes were broken, half of the mallet covers had broken/fallen off, and the balls somehow have gouges in them. There has to be better quality than this available. Not sure why there is a storage bag, this set can only be used once, then they are garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Seigler

customer_reviews.title: Broke after first use
customer_reviews.text: Used this and played one game and both balls used are already cracked. Terrible craftsmanship, I don’t advise getting this set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this item about a year ago and used ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item about a year ago and used it for the first time last week. The materials used to make the set are definitely substandard. The plastic ends broke and most of the heads came off the sticks. If you want a decent set,d
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Miniature size for kids.
customer_reviews.text: This set is for kids only, not adult use. I should've known why this was so cheap. Opened it up and was like wow, little kiddy balls and mallets. Sent it back. It wouldn't be a bad set for kids if that is what you are buying it for though.
customer_reviews.author: B-rad

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great game set my only complaint being you have to unscrew the heads everytime to fit in the bad
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but have to disassemble to fit in carrying bag.
customer_reviews.text: Okay quality, but in order to use the carrying bag, you have to take the handles back off each time. I want these on tight so they are sturdy/safe. I now use a large reusable grocery bag to carry it all around. Works fine, but not what I thought I was getting.
customer_reviews.author: LadyBuckeye

customer_reviews.title: Won’t buy it ever again
customer_reviews.text: Won’t buy this product ever again. The heads come off the sticks in two strokes. Not a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Yuvraj Sandhu

customer_reviews.title: It is a nice "looking" set
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice "looking" set. I like the durable wickets. The frame arrived broken in two places where the dowling was drilled. The first time out on "family game day" one of the handles snapped 8 inches from the connection to the mallot head. on a normal swing from wicket to wicket. One of the hoops to hold the balls in the carrier broke while assembling the frame. for the price...quality is not there.
customer_reviews.author: kelley Kanehen

customer_reviews.title: Low quality. Period.
customer_reviews.text: Really can’t believe how low quality these are. Even when new the heads wobble when attached. Storage rack broke after one use. Was just looking for a better than entry model set. This is NOT it. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: eric johnston

customer_reviews.title: Well made for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and heavy duty. I gave this to my brother in law for a gift and he loved it. We play croquet during family get togethers. The kids play as well, but the mallets are a little heavy for them. My brother in law has had it 6+ months with no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Bew80

customer_reviews.title: Quality material
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. White caps won't stay attached to some ends and handle won't screws on some heads. Pay more for a better set. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Whitcher

customer_reviews.title: Small for small hands.  Great for kids.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted it for may grandchildren ages 5 & 7. It was just the right size for them.
customer_reviews.author: A. B. Blanton

customer_reviews.title: Nice set
customer_reviews.text: Overall a nice set. Ours has only been used twice and my only issue is that the rubber coating on the balls started to crack. I'm hoping that it holds up a while before really coming off.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Could be worse
customer_reviews.text: The mallets themselves seem fine- the balls are a composite material that just does not hold up to being struck (and that slightly defeats the purpose of croquet). An okay set for occasional use; not absolutely awful but far from exceptional either.
customer_reviews.author: Simple

customer_reviews.title: It was a gift and the couple absolutely loved it! They were just married in a vintage ...
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift and the couple absolutely loved it! They were just married in a vintage wedding and this gift worked out beautifully!
customer_reviews.author: Linda L. Norris-Reese

customer_reviews.title: Not for outdoor use
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality, heads never stay on tight, mallets and balls split open if they see any kind of weather. This is more of a look at set then a play with set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: My daughter's family loved this gift (opened early
customer_reviews.text: My daughter's family loved this gift (opened early!). The only downside was the carry bag included, which isn't very strong and was damaged upon arrival. Not a setback, however, we just put everything together and played on.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T.

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: Very fun. Got here super fast. Not made as good as I thought it would be. Colors didn't match balls correctly. But overall, very fun. Probably will only last one season.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Shortt

customer_reviews.title: WE love this game and the set is awesome
customer_reviews.text: WE love this game and the set is awesome. Nice material and craftsmanship and a reasonable price. Came super fast and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Deatherage

customer_reviews.title: I must say I am very disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: First time ever writing a review ever on Amazon. I must say I am very disappointed in this product. We played our first game today ( unfortunately a week after the return window) and two sticks broke on us. Each stick’s shaft broke off from the head. The shafts are attached by screws which are not secured well into head. This product is poorly made. If I didn’t miss the return window I would be returning this today.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A very cheap  set that breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: This set broke very easily the first time we played with it handles snapped after a couple of hits didn't not even make it through one game. Son was very sad as it was a part of his birthday party.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna L. Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Works, but sort of flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The set is nice, but the mallets are kind of light and flimsy and small, so it's harder to hit the ball. It's a good starter set, though.
customer_reviews.author: R. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: when you hit the balls the plastic materials don't allow for a good strike. I would not buy this set again
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap materials, when you hit the balls the plastic materials don't allow for a good strike. I would not buy this set again, or recommend it to anyone. It's unfortunate, as this set is rated by many places as a top 10 set in the under $100 range.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Dietz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Quality set and such a fun game for kids and adults.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Functional but you get what you pay for so don’t expect high quality set.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Knecht

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good set
customer_reviews.text: These were great! Perfect for my daughter Alic in wonderland party. Now we are going to use them to play outside!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Rust

customer_reviews.title: Great quality set with one small issue.
customer_reviews.text: So this is a great quality set. However, because the wickets are so big and heavy which is a good thing the strap that holds them on the rack came immediately off. I was able to reattach though by pushing the screws back through a different part of the strap. Screws holding the straps are too small only cheap part of the set. Still a great set overall don’t waste your time with cheaper sets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a crappy product
customer_reviews.text: Parts were missing, holes not pre-drilled where they should have been...shoddy construction...don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mandel

customer_reviews.title: WORST GAME
customer_reviews.text: This game is made so cheaply and breaks DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Chris lincoln

customer_reviews.title: Started falling apart after a couple years
customer_reviews.text: Started out nice, but the wooden cart started falling apart after a couple years. Ball color faded fast, and one of the mallets completely broke.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bass

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother with this set
customer_reviews.text: This set is so cheap! It fell apart as I was trying to teach my 6 year how to play. The white plastic ends just broke off the ends of the mallets. Very disappointed as I read all the reviews on several sets prior to making a purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Pretty
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice set and easy to move about.
customer_reviews.author: Vandy C Fisher

product_meta.title: Franklin Sports Outdoor Croquet Set - 6 Player Croquet Set with Stakes, Mallets, Wickets, and Balls - Backyard/Lawn Croquet Set - Intermediate
product_meta.description: Style Name:IntermediateFranklin's Intermediate Croquet Set includes everything you need to assemble a unique course in your backyard and enjoy hours of family fun. The intermediate set is packed with six durable all-weather molded balls, six wood mallet handles and heads lacquered with a chestnut finish, two painted wood stakes and nine all-weather coated wickets.
feature_bullets: Intermediate backyard set has all you need for hours of fun
Includes (6) 7" by 1.8" wooden mallet heads with caps and 26" chestnut finished wood shafts
Complete set comes with (6) 2.75" all weather molded balls, (6) 18" painted wood stakes and (9) all weather coated bent wire wickets
Easy transport and storage using the included carry bag

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars611 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
